attributes.magic: ELF 32-bit MSB executable, PowerPC or cisco 4500, version 1 (SYSV), statically linked, not stripped

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis: Mirai-like DDoS botnet agent targeting Linux-ppc devices. The binary features a command-and-control (C2) communication loop, a self-propagating Telnet brute-force scanner, and multiple DDoS attack vectors including TCP, UDP, STD, and Layer 7 HTTP floods (targeting Cloudflare). Concrete indicators include strings for infecting hosts ('[ ORBIT ] Infection Success'), hardcoded C2 infrastructure (199.19.225.2), and common Mirai-style function names like 'processCmd', 'TelnetScanner', and 'touchMyself'.
